casebody.data:
Joseph H. HOERN et al., Plaintiffs-Appellees, v. NEW BRITAIN MACHINE COMPANY, a Connecticut corporation, Defendant-Appellant. No. 14315. United States Court of Appeals Sixth Circuit. Feb. 10, 1961. Heilman & Purcell, Saginaw, Mich., for plaintiff s-appellees. Higgs & Higgs, Bay City, Mich., Mitchell & Bechert, New York City, for defendant-appellant.

Before CECIL, WEICK and O’SULLIVAN, Circuit Judges.

ORDER.

The motion to dismiss the appeal in the above ease is hereby granted. Collier v. Picard, 6 Cir., 1956, 237 F.2d 234.
